episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the invention of edible crayons by a US Marine, the history of a police tea van called Teapot One, a soap opera created to sell soap, and the benefits of napping for memory retention.

facts.fact: US Marines are considered to be so stupid that members of the other armed forces called them crayon eaters. This year, a Marine has invented an actual edible crayon.
The London Metropolitan Police used to have a van called teapot one exclusively to deliver cups of tea to officers stuck at the scene of a crime.
The ninth longest running British soap ever was designed exclusively to sell soap.
If you take an hour long nap after listening to this show, you will remember five times as many facts from it.
